definitions: in a way that shows wisdom or prudence

examples.text: the committee sensibly decided not to go ahead with the meeting
the secret to her long life has been eating sensibly

shortDefinitions: in way that shows wisdom or prudence

definitions: in a practical and functional rather than decorative manner
shortDefinitions: in practical and functional rather than decorative manner

definitions: in a way that is readily perceived; perceptibly

examples.text: the tip becomes sensibly curved in one or two minutes

shortDefinitions: in way that is readily perceived

definitions: in a way that is able to notice or appreciate something; perceptively

examples.text: he's sensibly aware of the need

shortDefinitions: in way that is able to notice or appreciate something
